query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 O poca nostra nobiltà di sangue, 2 se glorïar di te la gente fai 3 qua giù dove l’affetto nostro langue,
query.error: **English:** 1 Oh, our nobility of blood, how little, 2 if people glorify you down here 3 where our affections languish,
query.result: 1 Aho asmākam kṣīṇaratnatvam, 2 yadi tvayā janāḥ praśasyante 3 atraiva yatra asmākam sneho mliyati,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 mirabil cosa non mi sarà mai: 5 ché là dove appetito non si torce, 6 dico nel cielo, io me ne gloriai.
query.error: **English:** 4 it will never be a wondrous thing to me: 5 for there where desire is not distorted, 6 I mean in Heaven, I gloried in it.
query.result: 4 adbhutam na me kadācit syāt: 5 yataḥ kāmasya vikṛtir na bhavati, 6 svarge eva aham tava guṇair abhimanyamānaḥ āsam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 Ben se’ tu manto che tosto raccorce: 8 sì che, se non s’appon di dì in die, 9 lo tempo va dintorno con le force.
query.error: **English:** 7 Indeed, you must admit that it shortens quickly: 8 so that, if you do not add day to day, 9 time goes around with its forces.
query.result: 7 Tvam khalu manyase yad āyur alpam eva kṣipram kṣīyate: 8 yasmāt, yadi dine dine na yojyate, 9 kālaḥ parivartate svabalair yuktaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Dal ‘voi’ che prima a Roma s’offerie, 11 in che la sua famiglia men persevra, 12 ricominciaron le parole mie;
query.error: **English:** 10 From the 'you' that first offered itself in Rome, 11 in whom his family persevered less, 12 my words began again;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 onde Beatrice, ch’era un poco scevra, 14 ridendo, parve quella che tossio 15 al primo fallo scritto di Ginevra.
query.error: **English:** 13 Whereupon Beatrice, who was a little withdrawn, 14 laughing, seemed like the one who coughed 15 at the first fault written of Guinevere.
query.result: 13 Yatraiva Beatrice, yā kācid alpam vivecitā, 14 hasantī, abhūt sā yathā kaścid kaśate 15 Ginevra-yāḥ prathame 'parādhe likhite.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 Per tanti rivi s’empie d’allegrezza 20 la mente mia, che di sé fa letizia 21 perché può sostener che non si spezza.
query.error: **English:** 19 Through so many streams my mind is filled with joy, 20 that it makes gladness of itself, 21 because it can sustain itself and not break.
query.result: 19 Tīrṇāir anekair ānandena pūrṇā 20 manas mama svayam eva hṛṣyati, 21 yataḥ śaknoti dhārayitum ātmānam abhinnam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 Ditemi dunque, cara mia primizia, 23 quai fuor li vostri antichi e quai fuor li anni 24 che si segnaro in vostra püerizia;
query.error: **English:** 22 Tell me then, my dear first love, 23 what were your ancestors like and what were the years 24 that marked your childhood;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 ditemi de l’ovil di San Giovanni 26 quanto era allora, e chi eran le genti 27 tra esso degne di più alti scanni».
query.error: **English:** 25 tell me about the sheepfold of San Giovanni, 26 how big it was then, and who were the people 27 among them worthy of the highest ranks.
query.result: 25 San Giovanni-kula-viṣaye mayā pṛṣṭā tvam ācakṣva, 26 tatra tadā kimātmikam āsīt, ke ca janāḥ 27 tatra uttama-sthānānām arhāḥ āsams.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Come s’avviva a lo spirar d’i venti 29 carbone in fiamma, così vid’ io quella 30 luce risplendere a’ miei blandimenti;
query.error: **English:** 28 As a coal is quickened to a flame by the breath of the wind, 29 so saw I that light quicken to a brighter flame 30 under my flattery;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 e come a li occhi miei si fé più bella, 32 così con voce più dolce e soave, 33 ma non con questa moderna favella,
query.error: **English:** 31 and as it became fairer to my eyes, 32 so with a voice more sweet and gentle, 33 but not in this modern speech,
query.result: 31 tathā madhura-mṛdu-tarena vācā, 32 na tu adhunātane 'smin bhāṣā-prayoge, 33 mayā saha uvāca: "Yasmāt dine 'Ave' iti uktam āsīt

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 dissemi: «Da quel dì che fu detto ‘Ave’ 35 al parto in che mia madre, ch’è or santa, 36 s’allevïò di me ond’ era grave,
query.error: **English:** 34 it said to me: "Since the day that the 'Ave' was said 35 to the birth in which my mother, who is now sainted, 36 was delivered of me, from whom she was heavy,
query.result: 34 yāvattaḥ prasuti-kāle yasya mātā, sā adhunā puṇyā, 35 mama bhāreṇa gurvī babhūva, 36 tasya siṃha-rāśau pañca-śata-pañcāśat-tathā

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 al suo Leon cinquecento cinquanta 38 e trenta fiate venne questo foco 39 a rinfiammarsi sotto la sua pianta.
query.error: **English:** 37 this fire has come to rekindle itself under its constellation Leo 38 five hundred and fifty times and thirty, 39 at the foot of its plant."
query.result: 37 triṃśat-varṣāṇi āgatāni asya agneḥ 38 sva-nakṣatreṇa saha punar-udīpanāya. 39 tasya mūle."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Li antichi miei e io nacqui nel loco 41 dove si truova pria l’ultimo sesto 42 da quei che corre il vostro annüal gioco.
query.error: **English:** 40 My ancestors and I were born in the place 41 where the last sixth is found first 42 by those who run your annual race.
query.result: 40 Mama pūrve janmāni mama ca janma abhavat tasmin deśe 41 Yatra prathamam uttamaḥ ṣaṣṭhaḥ bhāgaḥ prāpyate 42 Teṣām ye kurvanti yuṣmadīyaṃ vārṣikīṃ līlām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 Basti d’i miei maggiori udirne questo: 44 chi ei si fosser e onde venner quivi, 45 più è tacer che ragionare onesto.
query.error: **English:** 43 It is enough for you to hear this about my ancestors: 44 who they were and how they came here, 45 it is more honorable to be silent than to speak.
query.result: 43 Mama pūrvajānāṃ viṣaye etad eva śrotum arhasi: 44 ke ca te āsan, katham ca iha āgaman, 45 maunaṃ katham apīṣat kartum śreṣṭham.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Tutti color ch’a quel tempo eran ivi 47 da poter arme tra Marte e ’l Batista, 48 eran il quinto di quei ch’or son vivi.
query.error: **English:** 46 All those who were there at that time, 47 able to bear arms between March and the Baptist, 48 were the fifth of those who are now alive.
query.result: 46 Ye ye tadā tatra āsīt, 47 Ye ca Marteḥ saha Bāptistena astradhāraṇakṣamāḥ āsīt, 48 Te adya jīvantaḥ pañcamabhāgaḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Ma la cittadinanza, ch’è or mista 50 di Campi, di Certaldo e di Fegghine, 51 pura vediesi ne l’ultimo artista.
query.error: **English:** 49 But the citizenry, which is now mixed 50 of Campi, Certaldo, and Fegghine, 51 truly saw in him the ultimate artist.
query.result: 49 Api tu nagaraṃ, yat adhunā miśram asti 50 Campi, Certaldo, Fegghine ca, 51 pūrvam eva paśyati sma antaḥsthitaṃ śilpikaṃ śreṣṭham.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Oh quanto fora meglio esser vicine 53 quelle genti ch’io dico, e al Galluzzo 54 e a Trespiano aver vostro confine,
query.error: **English:** 52 Oh, how much better it would be to be neighbors 53 of those people I mentioned, and to have your borders 54 at Galluzzo and Trespiano,
query.result: 52 Aha, katham uttamam syāt sajja-nivāsaḥ 53 ye jana āmi kathayāmi, Gallutsau ca 54 Trespiano ca tava sīmā bhavet,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 che averle dentro e sostener lo puzzo 56 del villan d’Aguglion, di quel da Signa, 57 che già per barattare ha l’occhio aguzzo!
query.error: **English:** 55 than to have them inside and endure the stench 56 of the peasant from Aguglione, and the one from Signa, 57 who is always sharp-eyed for a bargain!
query.result: 55 yathāntar-gataḥ sahet durgandhim 56 Aguglione-grāma-jātasya, Signa-jātasya ca, 57 ye vikraye nīcakau cakṣuṣau.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Se la gente ch’al mondo più traligna 59 non fosse stata a Cesare noverca, 60 ma come madre a suo figlio benigna,
query.error: **English:** 58 If the people who are the most degenerate in the world 59 had not been a stepmother to Caesar, 60 but rather a kind mother to her son,
query.result: 58 Yadi janaḥ loke 'dhamaḥ syāt 59 na caesarasya dvitīyā mātā, 60 kintu putrasya mātā kṛpayā,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 tal fatto è fiorentino e cambia e merca, 62 che si sarebbe vòlto a Simifonti, 63 là dove andava l’avolo a la cerca;
query.error: **English:** 61 then the Florentine who has become a merchant and moneychanger 62 would have turned to Simifonti, 63 where his grandfather went begging;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 sariesi Montemurlo ancor de’ Conti; 65 sarieno i Cerchi nel piovier d’Acone, 66 e forse in Valdigrieve i Buondelmonti.
query.error: **English:** 64 Montemurlo would still belong to the Conti family; 65 the Cerchi family would be in the parish of Acone, 66 and perhaps the Buondelmonti family would be in Valdigrieve.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Sempre la confusion de le persone 68 principio fu del mal de la cittade, 69 come del vostro il cibo che s’appone;
query.error: **English:** 67 Always the confusion of the people 68 was the beginning of the evil of the city, 69 just as your food is the beginning of your evil;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 e cieco toro più avaccio cade 71 che cieco agnello; e molte volte taglia 72 più e meglio una che le cinque spade.
query.error: **English:** 70 and a blind bull falls more quickly 71 than a blind lamb; and many times one sword cuts 72 more and better than five.
query.result: 70 andhaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ adhikaṃ śīghram patati 71 andhāt meṣāt; anekaśaḥ ca chinatti 72 adhikaṃ ca śreṣṭhaṃ ekā pañcabhiḥ khaḍgaiḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Se tu riguardi Luni e Orbisaglia 74 come sono ite, e come se ne vanno 75 di retro ad esse Chiusi e Sinigaglia,
query.error: **English:** 73 If you look at Luni and Urbisaglia, 74 how they have gone, and how Chiusi and Sinigaglia 75 are going after them,
query.result: 73 Yadi tvam Luniṃ ca Urbiśālyām ca 74 paśyasi yathā gate, yathā ca gacchanti 75 paścāt tābhyāṃ Cuśiḥ ca Śinigalyā ca,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 udir come le schiatte si disfanno 77 non ti parrà nova cosa né forte, 78 poscia che le cittadi termine hanno.
query.error: **English:** 76 you will hear how lineages come to an end. 77 It will not seem new or strange to you, 78 since cities have a limited lifespan.
query.result: 76 śṛṇu yathā vaṃśāḥ vinasyanti. 77 Na te dṛśyeta navaṃ vā durbalam vā, 78 yataḥ puraḥsīmānī bhavanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Le vostre cose tutte hanno lor morte, 80 sì come voi; ma celasi in alcuna 81 che dura molto, e le vite son corte.
query.error: **English:** 79 All your things have their death, 80 just like you; but it is hidden in some 81 that last a long time, and lives are short.
query.result: 79 Bhavatām vastūni sarvāṇi asti teṣām mṛtyuḥ, 80 yathā yūyam; api tu tiryak sthiteṣu keṣu cit 81 yat dīrgham kālam tiṣṭhati, jīvitāni tu kṣipra-kṣayiṇīni santi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 E come ’l volger del ciel de la luna 83 cuopre e discuopre i liti sanza posa, 84 così fa di Fiorenza la Fortuna:
query.error: **English:** 82 And just as the turning of the sky and the moon 83 covers and uncovers the shores without pause, 84 so does Fortune do to Florence:
query.result: 82 Evaṃ ca yathā nabhasaḥ candrasya ca parivartanaṃ 83 niravadhīṃ nirantaraṃ tīrāṇi ācchādayati prakāśayati ca, 84 tathāiva daivam api tathā karoti Fiorentinaṃ prati:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 per che non dee parer mirabil cosa 86 ciò ch’io dirò de li alti Fiorentini 87 onde è la fama nel tempo nascosa.
query.error: **English:** 85 therefore it should not seem a wondrous thing 86 what I will say about the lofty Florentines 87 whose fame is hidden in time.
query.result: 85 atas tasmāt na caryā viśmayāvahaṃ bhavitum arhati 86 yat ahaṃ vakṣyāmi Fiorentinaṃ uttamajanānāṃ viṣaye 87 yeṣāṃ kīrtiḥ kālena gūḍhā vartate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 Io vidi li Ughi e vidi i Catellini, 89 Filippi, Greci, Ormanni e Alberichi, 90 già nel calare, illustri cittadini;
query.error: **English:** 88 I saw the Ughi and I saw the Catellini, 89 Filippi, Greci, Ormanni, and Alberichi, 90 already in decline, illustrious citizens;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 e vidi così grandi come antichi, 92 con quel de la Sannella, quel de l’Arca, 93 e Soldanieri e Ardinghi e Bostichi.
query.error: **English:** 91 and I saw some as great as the ancients, 92 with him of the Sannella, him of the Arca, 93 and Soldanieri and Ardinghi and Bostichi.
query.result: 91 evam ca paśyāmi pūrvebhyaḥ samānān, 92 Sannellasya tena, Arcasya tena saha, 93 Soldanierān, Ardinghān, Bostichān.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 Sovra la porta ch’al presente è carca 95 di nova fellonia di tanto peso 96 che tosto fia iattura de la barca,
query.error: **English:** 94 Above the gate, which is now burdened 95 with such a weight of new felony 96 that soon the bark will be destroyed,
query.result: 94 Tadvārāṇāmagre yad idānīm 95 atibhāriṇī nāma nūtanaṃ pāpaṃ 96 yena naurāśīghram vināśam āpsyate,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 erano i Ravignani, ond’ è disceso 98 il conte Guido e qualunque del nome 99 de l’alto Bellincione ha poscia preso.
query.error: **English:** 97 were the Ravignani, from whom descended 98 Count Guido and all those who have since taken 99 the name of the noble Bellincione.
query.result: 97 Ravignāni-nāmāna āsan, yataḥ 98 Guido-nāmako rājā samabhavat, tathā ye 99 tataḥ param Bellincione-nāmadheyam ādaduḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Quel de la Pressa sapeva già come 101 regger si vuole, e avea Galigaio 102 dorata in casa sua già l’elsa e ’l pome.
query.error: **English:** 100 He of La Pressa already knew how 101 one must conduct oneself, and Galigaio 102 already had the hilt and pommel gilded in his house.
query.result: 100 Saḥ La Pressāyāḥ jānāti sma katham 101 varttavyaṃ syāt, ca Galigaḥ 102 svagṛhe eva hiraṇmayīm kṛtvā elsaṃ pome ca āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Grand’ era già la colonna del Vaio, 104 Sacchetti, Giuochi, Fifanti e Barucci 105 e Galli e quei ch’arrossan per lo staio.
query.error: **English:** 103 The column of the Vaio was already grand, 104 Sacchetti, Giuochi, Fifanti, and Barucci, 105 and Galli and those who blush for the bushel.
query.result: 103 Vaioḥ stambhaḥ āsīt mahat, 104 Sacchetti, Giuochi, Fifanti, Barucci ca, 105 Galli ca ye ca lajjante viṣṭau.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 Lo ceppo di che nacquero i Calfucci 107 era già grande, e già eran tratti 108 a le curule Sizii e Arrigucci.
query.error: **English:** 106 The stump from which the Calfucci were born 107 was already large, and already had been drawn 108 to the curule chairs the Sizii and the Arrigucci.
query.result: 106 Yaḥ śirṣakaṇḍaḥ Calfucci-nāmānāṃ jātaḥ, 107 Saḥ tataḥ pūrva eva mahān āsīt, tataś ca 108 Sizii-nāmānaḥ, Arrigucci-nāmānaś ca puruṣau

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Oh quali io vidi quei che son disfatti 110 per lor superbia! e le palle de l’oro 111 fiorian Fiorenza in tutt’ i suoi gran fatti.
query.error: **English:** 109 Oh, how many I saw who were undone 110 by their pride! And the balls of gold 111 made Florence flourish in all her great deeds.
query.result: 109 Aha, kati aham adarśam tānaparenapi 110 abhimānena vināśitān! Tataśca hiraṇya-piṇḍāḥ 111 pūrṇāḥ kṛtāḥ kṛtārthāḥ sarveṣu karma-viśeṣeṣu.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Così facieno i padri di coloro 113 che, sempre che la vostra chiesa vaca, 114 si fanno grassi stando a consistoro.
query.error: **English:** 112 Thus did the fathers of those 113 who, whenever your church is vacant, 114 grow fat by staying in consistory.
query.result: 112 Evam cakruḥ pitaraḥ teṣām 113 ye, yadā yadā bhavati śūnyā yūyam, 114 sthūlā bhavanti niṣaṇṇāḥ pariṣadi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 L’oltracotata schiatta che s’indraca 116 dietro a chi fugge, e a chi mostra ’l dente 117 o ver la borsa, com’ agnel si placa,
query.error: **English:** 115 The arrogant brood that swaggers 116 behind those who flee, and shows its teeth 117 or its purse, like a lamb is appeased,
query.result: 115 Atikrāntā yā jātiḥ svayam abhimānam karoti 116 yaḥ palāyati tasya paścād yaś ca dantam darśayati 117 vā api vitta-kośam, sa mayūka iva śāmyati,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 già venìa sù, ma di picciola gente; 119 sì che non piacque ad Ubertin Donato 120 che poï il suocero il fé lor parente.
query.error: **English:** 118 was already rising, but with a small following; 119 so that it did not please Ubertino Donato 120 that his father-in-law later made them his relatives.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 Già era ’l Caponsacco nel mercato 122 disceso giù da Fiesole, e già era 123 buon cittadino Giuda e Infangato.
query.error: **English:** 121 Caponsacco was already in the marketplace, 122 having come down from Fiesole, and so was 123 the good citizen Giuda and Infangato.
query.result: 121 Kaponsakaḥ pūrvameva haṭṭe 122 Fieśolāt āgataḥ, tathā ca āsīt 123 śubhaḥ prajā Giudaḥ ca Infangataḥ ca.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Io dirò cosa incredibile e vera: 125 nel picciol cerchio s’entrava per porta 126 che si nomava da quei de la Pera.
query.error: **English:** 124 I will tell an incredible but true thing: 125 through a small gate one entered the little circle, 126 which was named "Of the Pear" by those from there.
query.result: 124 Aham vakṣyāmi yat aviśvasanīyam satyam ca: 125 Kṣudra-maṇḍale praviśyate sma dvāreṇa, 126 Yat "Pera" iti nāmnā abhidhīyate tatra-sthitaih.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Ciascun che de la bella insegna porta 128 del gran barone il cui nome e ’l cui pregio 129 la festa di Tommaso riconforta,
query.error: **English:** 127 Everyone who bears the beautiful emblem 128 of the great baron whose name and whose worth 129 the feast of Thomas comforts,
query.result: 127 Yaḥ kaścid api suśobhanasya dhvajasya dhārayitā 128 Mahānubhāvasya yasya nāma yaśaś ca 129 Tomasasya utsavaḥ santarpitaḥ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 da esso ebbe milizia e privilegio; 131 avvegna che con popol si rauni 132 oggi colui che la fascia col fregio.
query.error: **English:** 130 from him received knighthood and privilege; 131 although he has gathered with the people today 132 the one who adorns the sash with the ornament.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 Già eran Gualterotti e Importuni; 134 e ancor saria Borgo più quïeto, 135 se di novi vicin fosser digiuni.
query.error: **English:** 133 Already there were the Gualterotti and the Importuni; 134 and Borgo would still be quieter, 135 if it were free of new neighbors.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 La casa di che nacque il vostro fleto, 137 per lo giusto disdegno che v’ha morti 138 e puose fine al vostro viver lieto,
query.error: **English:** 136 The house from which your weeping was born, 137 because of the just disdain that killed you 138 and put an end to your happy life,
query.result: 136 Yasmāt gṛhāt tava rodanam ajāyata, 137 Yataḥ satyena krodhena yaḥ tvām aghātayīt 138 Tava ca prītimatīṃ jīvitīm antaṃ nayat,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
139 era onorata, essa e suoi consorti: 140 o Buondelmonte, quanto mal fuggisti 141 le nozze süe per li altrui conforti!
query.error: **English:** 139 was honored, it and its allies: 140 O Buondelmonte, how badly you shunned 141 its marriage ties because of the advice of others!
query.result: 139 Saṃmānitaṃ āsīt tat tathā tasya bandhavaḥ: 140 He Buondelmonte, katham durlabham tvayā parityaktam 141 Tasyāḥ vivāhaḥ anyeṣām upadeśāt!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
142 Molti sarebber lieti, che son tristi, 143 se Dio t’avesse conceduto ad Ema 144 la prima volta ch’a città venisti.
query.error: **English:** 142 Many who are sad would be joyful 143 if God had granted you to the Adimari 144 the first time you came to the city.
query.result: 142 Ye adhunā duḥkhitāḥ santi, te sukham anubhaveyuḥ, 143 Yadi Bhagavān tvām Adimari-kule dadāti 144 Prathamaṃ yadā nagaraṃ prāpya āgato 'bhūḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
145 Ma conveniesi a quella pietra scema 146 che guarda ’l ponte, che Fiorenza fesse 147 vittima ne la sua pace postrema.
query.error: **English:** 145 But it is fitting for you to go to that unfinished stone 146 that guards the bridge, which Florence made 147 as a victim in its final peace.
query.result: 145 Tathāpi tavaiva yuktaṃ tad upetyaikaśilāṃ viśeṣām 146 Sā hi rakṣati setau yasya nirmitaṃ puras tatpuram 147 Baliṃ kṛtvā svayam śāntiṃ pratiṣṭhāpya ca niṣṭhitām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
148 Con queste genti, e con altre con esse, 149 vid’ io Fiorenza in sì fatto riposo, 150 che non avea cagione onde piangesse.
query.error: **English:** 148 With these people, and with others with them, 149 I saw Florence in such a state of peace, 150 that it had no cause to weep.
query.result: 148 Etaiḥ saha janaiḥ anyaiśca saha taiḥ, 149 Apaśyam aham Fiorentinaṃ tathāvidhe viśrāme, 150 Yathā na āsīt tasya rodanasya kāraṇam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
151 Con queste genti vid’io glorïoso 152 e giusto il popol suo, tanto che ’l giglio 153 non era ad asta mai posto a ritroso,
query.error: **English:** 151 With these people I saw glorious 152 and just their people, so much so that the lily 153 was never placed upside down on a flagpole,
query.result: 151 Etaiḥ saha janaiḥ apaśyam aścaryam 152 nyāyyam ca tasya prajāḥ, yāvat padmam 153 na kadācid dhvaje viparītam sthāpitam āsīt,
